page.title: 04FARMING: NATIONAL TRUST
page.content: To the north of the A458 road and west of Burnt Tree/King Street road the land belongs to{The National Trust based at Attingham Hall. There are 6 farms:{Lower Betton, Cronkhill, {Cotons, Lower Cound, Upper Brompton and{Lower Brompton.}Only the latter farm is tenant farmed. This farm is close to the River Severn and is the only farm in the whole area that has large amounts of grassland for hay. This is because it is still a{dairy farm with{friesian cattle.}The other farms have in the last 3 years reduced their livestock and have become{arable based farms. Major crops are{barley, {wheat and sugar beet.}The barley, much autumn sown, is for malting and the sugar beet is taken to Allscott Sugar Beet Factory ten miles away.
